oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: David Cobb - Grant Turner stories - 1977-05-31
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First recording contains excerpts from a Grand Ole Opry segment featuring Louie Buck (announcer), and performers Red Foley, Roy Acuff, Claude Sharpe and the Old Hickory Singers, Minnie Pearl, and Rod Brasfield on radio station WSM (Nashville, Tenn.) Second recording contains excerpts from an unidentified radio program with both German and American announcers. Third recording contains David Cobb telling stories about Grant Turner, himself, and others on the WSM crew on May 31, 1977.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Red Foley; Claude Sharpe; Old Hickory Singers; Roy Acuff; Minnie Pearl; Rod Brasfield
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Opening theme -- Louie Buck introduces Red Foley -- John Henry (Red Foley) -- Red Foley introduces Claude Sharpe and the Old Hickory Singers -- Meet Me In St. Louis (Claude Sharpe and the Old Hickory Singers -- Red Foley introduces Roy Acuff -- Roy Acuff talks -- The Waltz Of The Wind (Roy Acuff) -- Red Foley talks about Acuff's performance and introduces Minnie Pearl -- Opening theme -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Red Foley talks about the song he is about to perform -- Farther Along (Red Foley) -- Red Foley introduces Acuff and the song he is about to perform -- Thank God (Roy Acuff) -- Red Foley introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield) (incomplete) -- Overseas radio show with German and American announcers and swing music -- David Cobb tells a story about Grant Turner, T. Tommy Cutrer, and Don Russell -- David Cobb tells a story about bringing fake vomit on stage at the Opry -- David Cobb talks about his respect for Grant Turner
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Sharpe, Claude, 1902-1969; Old Hickory Singers; Acuff, Roy; Acuff, Roy, 1903-1992; Minnie Pearl; Cannon, Sarah Ophelia, 1912-1996; Brasfield, Rod, 1910-1958; Cobb, David (Announcer);
